documentation.description:
Computes class assignments according to the Electre TRI-C method.
This method uses central reference actions (profiles) instead of boundary actions known from Electre TRI.
Definitions of the classes to be considered for the assignments. Each class must have its rank provided as an integer, where the lowest number defines the most preferred class.
Definitions of central profiles which should be used for classes representation.
Credibility matrix (alternatives vs central profiles) which should be used in exploitation procedure.

Outranking matrix (alternatives vs central profiles) which should be used in exploitation procedure.
Please note that instead of numeric values for each pair of alternatives/profiles, this matrix should contain the actual types of outranking relations given as strings, i.e. 'preference', 'indifference', 'incomparability' or 'none'. For more on this see documentation for the 'cutRelationCrisp' module, which produces such output.
Assignments of the alternatives computed from the given data. The assignments are provided as intervals, i.e. combining the results of 'descending' and 'ascending' assignment procedures.
Messages or errors generated by this module.
